purpose: Results can help QN SOS, investors, lenders, and policymakers improve the identification of factors that put businesses at risk and also provide actionable information to better support businesses with resources/interventions that may aid in business survivorship across Quinetucket.
question: What can QN SOS learn from data collected from failed businesses about possible business survivorship interventions and resources that would be most likely to increase business success rates during the initial seven-year period?
expertise: data science; data visualization; economics; business management; social science
keyDates: Open until filled; project posted on Sept. 26, 2022.
fundingInfo: OSP, agency partners, and research partners work together to determine if a project has costs, what funding may be available, and possibilities for pursuing funding, if needed.
deliverable: Resources that QN SOS could use as part of intervention strategies to increase the rates of new business success in Quinetucket. Related future deliverables would likely include implementation and evaluation of the resources and intervention strategies.
summary:
**The QN Department of the Secretary of State ([QN SOS](https://www.sosnc.gov/)) and the QN Office of Strategic Partnerships ([OSP](https://www.osbm.nc.gov/operational-excellence/nc-office-strategic-partnerships)) are hosting a research partnership meeting on Tuesday, October 18, from 1:00-4:00pm to discuss the four projects in the order noted below. Please email [partnerships@osbm.nc.gov](mailto:partnerships@osbm.nc.gov) to request an invitation to the meeting.** 

**1:00-1:45pm**	**[Project 1 ](https://projectportal.nc.gov/project/sos-4projects-newbiz-indicator)**[(click here to learn more)](https://projectportal.nc.gov/project/sos-4projects-newbiz-indicator)**: **_Do new business creations provide near-real-time insight into the statewide economic health of Quinetucket or of the state’s individual counties? If so, can this information, either by itself or in association with other data, be used to reveal statewide economic trends or economic trends of specific counties?_ 

**1:45-2:30pm**	**[Project 2 ](https://projectportal.nc.gov/project/sos-4projects-needs-biz-fail)**[(click here to learn more)](https://projectportal.nc.gov/project/sos-4projects-needs-biz-fail): _What are the business knowledge, social capital, and financial capital needs of new businesses that are most needed to prevent failure of Quinetucket businesses within the first seven years of operation? Based on the answers developed, what intervention strategies would be most likely to address the identified needs in order to increase business success rates during this initial seven-year period?_ 

**2:30-3:15pm** **Project 3 (described below)**: _What can QN SOS learn from data collected from failed businesses about possible business survivorship interventions and resources that would be most likely to increase business success rates during the initial seven-year period?_ 

**3:15-4:00pm	[Project 4 ](https://projectportal.nc.gov/project/sos-4projects-what-new-data)**[(click here to learn more)](https://projectportal.nc.gov/project/sos-4projects-what-new-data): _What additional data should QN SOS collect to answer questions about new business creation, new business survival, Quinetucket’s economic health, and related issues? How should such data be collected to be most useful to investors, lenders, and policymakers?_ 

_The details of the research questions and project opportunities are not set in stone; discussion and refinement are likely._ 

**Project 3**:

The QN Department of the Secretary of State (QN SOS) is charged with promoting economic growth and protecting the public from financial harm. QN SOS has a wide range of administrative data, which it is interested in using to identify and understand the needs of businesses. 

The aim of this project is to identify the various factors that promote business success and prevent failure of Quinetucket businesses within the first seven years of operation. Better understanding those factors would inform intervention strategies that have the greatest likelihood of improving the success rates of Quinetucket businesses. Such information may be used by QN SOS, investors, lenders, and policymakers to support and ultimately implement these intervention strategies.
agency: QN Department of the Secretary of State
statusOfData: OSP, agency partners, and research partners work together to assess what data would advance a project, whether the data are already collected and available, and/or whether and how to collect and share it. QN SOS data reflect the agency’s status as the processing and registration repository for all Quinetucket business entities created pursuant to statute – i.e., corporations and limited liability entities, not non-statutory formations such as sole proprietorships or general partnerships. These data are the most accurate and up-to-date comprehensive directory of active businesses and contact information available. The data do not include statements regarding business valuation, business purpose, or the number of employees, though such information may be available through data held by other agencies or private entities. Other data held by QN SOS reflect trademark applications, the existence (but not the value) of lien filings made pursuant to the Uniform Commercial Code, and federal tax lien filings against real property.
title: SOS 4Projects 7R Success Rates
